text.div:
Narratif généré : DéfinitionStructure as-ext-authorization

NomDrapeauxCard.TypeDescription et contraintes
Extension 0..*ExtensionAS Authorization Extension
Slices pour extension Content/Rules for all slices
extension:dateAuthorization 0..1ExtensionDate de délivrance de l’autorisation.
extension 0..0
url 1..1uri"dateAuthorization"
value[x] 0..1dateValue of extension
extension:periodAuthorization 0..1ExtensionExtension
extension 0..0
url 1..1uri"periodAuthorization"
value[x] 0..1PeriodValue of extension
start 0..1dateTimeDate de première mise en œuvre.
end 0..1dateTimeDate de fin de mise en œuvre.
extension:dateUpdateAuthorization 0..1ExtensionDate de dernière mise à jour de l’autorisation.
extension 0..0
url 1..1uri"dateUpdateAuthorization"
value[x] 0..1dateValue of extension
extension:deletedAuthorization 0..1ExtensionIndicateur de suppression de l'autorisation.
extension 0..0
url 1..1uri"deletedAuthorization"
value[x] 0..1booleanValue of extension
url 1..1uri"https://interop.esante.gouv.fr/ig/fhir/annuaire/StructureDefinition/as-ext-authorization"
value[x] 0..0

Documentation for this format

name: AsAuthorizationExtension
title: AS Authorization Extension
publisher: Agence du Numérique en Santé (ANS) - 2-10 Rue d'Oradour-sur-Glane, 75015 Paris

contact.name: Agence du Numérique en Santé (ANS) - 2-10 Rue d'Oradour-sur-Glane, 75015 Paris

description: Extension créée dans le cadre de l'Annuaire Santé pour décrire les autorisations des activités (HealthcareService) sanitaires, sociales, médico-sociales et d'enseignement et des équipements matériels (Device) lourds autorisés.

element.definition: Extension créée dans le cadre de l'Annuaire Santé pour décrire les autorisations des activités (HealthcareService) sanitaires, sociales, médico-sociales et d'enseignement et des équipements matériels (Device) lourds autorisés.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children
Must have either extensions or value[x], not both

element.definition: Unique id for the element within a resource (for internal references). This may be any string value that does not contain spaces.

slicing.description: Extensions are always sliced by (at least) url

element.definition: May be used to represent additional information that is not part of the basic definition of the element. To make the use of extensions safe and manageable, there is a strict set of governance  applied to the definition and use of extensions. Though any implementer can define an extension, there is a set of requirements that SHALL be met as part of the definition of the extension.
element.comment: There can be no stigma associated with the use of extensions by any application, project, or standard - regardless of the institution or jurisdiction that uses or defines the extensions.  The use of extensions is what allows the FHIR specification to retain a core level of simplicity for everyone.

Must have either extensions or value[x], not both

element.short: identifies the meaning of the extension
element.definition: Source of the definition for the extension code - a logical name or a URL.
element.comment: The definition may point directly to a computable or human-readable definition of the extensibility codes, or it may be a logical URI as declared in some other specification. The definition SHALL be a URI for the Structure Definition defining the extension.

element.definition: Value of extension - must be one of a constrained set of the data types (see [Extensibility](http://hl7.org/fhir/R4/extensibility.html) for a list).

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children
Must have either extensions or value[x], not both

element.short: Date de première mise en œuvre.
element.definition: The start of the period. The boundary is inclusive.
element.comment: If the low element is missing, the meaning is that the low boundary is not known.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.short: Date de fin de mise en œuvre.
element.definition: The end of the period. If the end of the period is missing, it means no end was known or planned at the time the instance was created. The start may be in the past, and the end date in the future, which means that period is expected/planned to end at that time.
element.comment: The high value includes any matching date/time. i.e. 2012-02-03T10:00:00 is in a period that has an end value of 2012-02-03.
element.meaningWhenMissing: If the end of the period is missing, it means that the period is ongoing
